text: The knockout stage of UEFA Women's Euro 2017 started on 29 July 2017 and ended on 6 August 2017 with the final. == Format == In the knockout stage, if the match ended as a draw, they play extra time and have a penalty shoot-out to decide who wins. On the 1st of June 2017, the UEFA Executive Committee decided that in this competition, teams can make a fourth substitution during extra time. This was part of a trial by the International Football Association Board (IFAB). == Qualified teams == Only the top two teams from the four groups, qualified for the knockout stage.
